{{About|a capital budgeting concept|other uses|ARR (disambiguation){{!}}ARR}}
{{accounting}}'''Accounting rate of return''', also known as the '''Average rate of return''', or '''ARR''' is a [[financial ratio]] used in [[capital budgeting]].<ref>[http://www.answers.com/topic/accounting-rate-of-return-arr Accounting Rate of Return - ARR]</ref> The ratio does not take into account the concept of [[time value of money]]. ARR calculates the [[Rate of return|return]], generated from [[net income]] of the proposed capital [[investment]]. The ARR is a percentage return. Say, if ARR = 7%, then it means that the project is expected to earn seven cents out of each dollar invested (yearly). If the ARR is equal to or greater than the required rate of return, the project is acceptable. If it is less than the desired rate, it should be rejected. When comparing investments, the higher the ARR, the more attractive the investment. More than half of large firms calculate ARR when appraising projects.<ref>Arnold, G. (2007). Essentials of corporate financial management. London: Pearson Education, Ltd.</ref>
The key advantage of ARR is that it is easy to compute and understand. The main disadvantage of ARR is that it disregards the time factor in terms of [[time value of money]] or [[Risk management|risks]] for long term investments. The ARR is built on evaluation of profits and it can be easily manipulated with changes in [[Depreciation (economics)|depreciation]] methods. The ARR can give misleading information when evaluating investments of different size.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tiduko.com/how-to-calculate-accounting-rate-of-return.html|title=How to Calculate Accounting Rate of Return {{!}} Tiduko.com {{!}} Never Stop Learning|website=tiduko.com|language=en|access-date=2017-04-25}}</ref>
==Basic formulas== : <math>\text{ARR} = \frac{\text{Average return during period}}{\text{Average investment}}</math>
where:
: <math>\text{Average investment} = \frac{\text{Book value at beginning of year 1 + Book value at end of useful life}}{\text{2}}</math>
: <math>\mbox{Average return during period} = {\mbox{Incremental revenue} -\mbox{ Incremental expenses (including depreciation)}\over \mbox{Initial investment}}</math>
: <math>\mbox{Average profit} = {\mbox{Profit after tax}\over \mbox{Life of investment}}</math>
== Pitfalls == # This technique is based on profits rather than [[cash flow]]. It ignores cash flow from investment. Therefore, it can be affected by non-cash items such as [[bad debt]]s and [[depreciation]] when calculating profits. The change of methods for depreciation can be manipulated and lead to higher profits. # This technique does not adjust for the risk to long term forecasts. # ARR doesn't take into account the [[time value of money]].

[[École nationale d'administration|National School of
Administration, Strasbourg]] }} '''Anne-Marie Idrac''' (born 27 July 1951 in [[Saint-Brieuc]], Côtes-d'Armor) is a French politician, member of the [[Nouveau Centre]] political party,{{cite web |url=http://www.nouveaucentre.fr/page/le-centre-se-recompose-au-nouveau-centre |title=Le centre se recompose au Nouveau Centre ! |publisher=[[Nouveau Centre]] |accessdate=6 June 2010 |date=8 December 2009 }} was French Minister of State for foreign trade. == Biography == Idrac, an alumna of the [[Institut d'Études Politiques de Paris|Institute of political studies of Paris]] (''Sciences Po''), and of the [[École Nationale d'Administration]], was, from 1974 to 1995, civil administrator in various posts in the [[Minister of Public Works (France)]], of housing, of the environment, of urbanism and of transports.{{cite web |url=http://www.actu-cci.com/?pg=mag_article&id_m_a=2180 |title=Anne-Marie Idrac au Commerce extérieur |publisher=[[Commerce international]] |accessdate=6 June 2010|date=2 April 2008 }} She was also general director of the public establishment of rural development of [[Cergy-Pontoise]] from 1990 to 1993. In 1995, still director of land transports, she was called to the government as woman issued from the civil society, to the post of Transportation State Secretary, which she occupied under the two Juppé governments. She conducted the legislative reform of 1996 which led to the debt-clearing of the SNCF by the creation of the RFF, and to the experimentation in 5 regions of de-centralisation of regional trains ([[TER]]), extended in 2001 by Jean-Claude Gayssot. Daughter of [[André Colin]], the head of MRP and of political parties which succeeded it at the centre, she chose to join [[François Bayrou]]'s Democratic Force and the [[Union for French Democracy]] (UDF). She was elected UDF deputy of the third circonscription of the Yvelines in 1997 and re-elected in 2002, losing to Hervé Morin to the presidency of the group UDF at the National Assembly. She was chairman of the regional council of the Île-de-France (1998–2002) and was general secretary to the 'Nouvelle Union' for the French Democracy (UDF). In September 2002, she left her mandate and political functions to take on the presidency of the RATP, on the suggestion of Prime Minister [[Jean-Pierre Raffarin]]. Christian Blanc, ally to the UDF, who had been one of her predecessors at the RATP, and with whom she has led the fusion of Air-France/Air-Inter to completion, became her successor at the [[National Assembly of France|National Assembly]]. Her mandate years at the [[Régie Autonome des Transports Parisiens|RATP]] are marked most notably by the reform of retirement financing, the launching of automation of Parisian metro's line 1, the installation of a guaranteed contractual service in case of strikes, as well as contracts in foreign countries. Brought back to the post for a mandate of 5 years in July 2004, she resigned on 12 July 2006 to succeed [[Louis Gallois]] as head of the [[SNCF]], the latter being called to [[EADS]]. She was involved in the development of TGV lines at a European dimension, to the relaunch of regional transportation, and to the regeneration of the network for RFF, and to the rectification of the fret situation. She obtained the creation of an autonomous fund for retired railwaymen, rendered necessary by the application to enterprise of IFRS accounting norms. ==Other activities== ===Corporate boards=== * [[Air France–KLM]], Independent Member of the Board of Directors[https://www.airfranceklm.com/en/board-directors Board of Directors] [[Air France–KLM]]. * [[Bouygues]], Member of the Board of Directors * [[Saint-Gobain]], Member of the Board of Directors * [[Total S.A.|Total]], Member of the Advisory Boardhttp://www.total.com/fr/medias/biographies/biographies-des-membres-du-conseil-dadministration?%FFbw=kludge1%FF * [[Sia Partners]], Senior Advisor (since 2011)http://www.latribune.fr/actualites/economie/france/20110620trib000630671/anne-marie-idrac-part-dans-le-prive-.html * [[Toulouse–Blagnac Airport]], Chairwoman of the Supervisory Board (2015-2018) * [[Dexia]], Member of the Advisory Board (2002–2007) ===Non-profit organizations=== * Member of the Orientation Council of the association ''En Temps Réel'' * [[Institut français des relations internationales]] (IFRI), Member of the Administration Council * Robert Schuman Foundation, Member of the Administration Council * [[HEC School of Management]], Member of the Advisory Board * Junior official of the [[National defence Institute of high studies]] (IHEDN), in 1986–87 (XXXIXe session) * European-French Movement, President (2000-2004) == Governmental functions == * Secretary of state to the ministry of rural development, in charge of transportation to the first government [[Alain Juppé]] (from 18 May to 6 November 1995). She used to be a member of the Juppettes. * Secretary of State to the ministry of Equipment, of housing and of Transports and Tourism, in charge of the Transports in the second government of [[Alain Juppé]] (from 6 November 1995 to 4 June 1997). *Secretary of State to the ministry of Economy, Industry and Employment, in charge of Foreign Commerce in the second government of [[François Fillon]] (from 18 March 2008 to 13 November 2010). ==References== {{reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Idrac, Anne-Marie}} [[Category:1951 births]] [[Category:École nationale d'administration alumni]] [[Category:Economy of France]] [[Category:French businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Panthéon-Assas University alumni]] [[Category:People from Saint-Brieuc]] [[Category:Politicians of the French Fifth Republic]] [[Category:Sciences Po alumni]] [[Category:SNCF]]

{{ad|date=November 2018}} {{Infobox Convention | name = Anuga FoodTec | status = Active | genre = [[food processing]], [[food packaging]], [[food safety]], [[services & solutions]], [[food ingredients]] | venue = [[Cologne Trade Fair|Cologne Trade Fair Center (Koelnmesse)]] | location = [[Cologne]] | country = Germany | first = 1996 | organizer = [[Cologne Trade Fair|Koelnmesse GmbH]] | attendance = 45,604 from 139 countries (2015) | website = http://www.anugafoodtec.com/ }} {{wide image|Koelnmesse Nordeingang.jpg|700px|Koelnmesse North Entrance|280px|right|alt=Koelnmesse North Entrance}}
The ''' Anuga FoodTec ''' (official subtitle ''International supplier fair for the food and drink industry'') is the world’s leading trade fair for the food and drink industry. It covers all aspects of food production from processing, filling and packaging technology as well as packaging materials and ingredients to food safety and innovations in all areas associated with food production.
It takes place in [[Cologne]] - [[Germany]] biennially (every 2 years). The organizer is [[Cologne Trade Fair]] (koelnmesse). The non-material sponsor is [[German Agricultural Society]] (Deutsche Landwirtschafts-Gesellschaft e.V. DLG).
Resource efficiency is one of the focal points of Anuga FoodTec. A protective and efficient use of natural resources is considered the key competence of future societies. Exhibitors demonstrate a variety of [[solution]]s{{solution-inline|date=November 2018}} for strengthening competitiveness while reducing the use of energy, water and food in production. The numerous events that make up the framework programme also illuminate this topic from various angles.
== History ==
Originating from the former Anuga-Technica and the DLG-FoodTec fairs, Anuga FoodTec has been providing a comprehensive process-oriented overview of all the technologies required for food production, from processing and packaging to distribution, since 1996. <ref>[http://supermarketnews.com/archive/dlg-foodtec-anuga-detail-trade-event-plan DLG FOODTEC, ANUGA DETAIL TRADE EVENT PLAN]</ref> Its independence from specific industries, raw materials, and sub-processes has made the trade fair one of the leading information and procurement platforms in the global food industry.
In 2012, 42,986 visitors (from 126 countries) came to Anuga FoodTec and could obtain information from 1,289 exhibitors (from 41 countries) on a total surface area of 127,000 square meters. <ref>[http://www.auma.de/_pages/MesseDetailListe.aspx?id=103807&sprache=e Anuga FoodTec at the official trade database AUMA]</ref> <ref>[http://www.potatopro.com/Lists/News/DispForm.aspx?ID=5777 Anuga Foodtec 2012 expands exhibition space due to strong demand]</ref>The trade fair also saw a positive development in 2012 in the number of exhibitors (10%) and visitors (27%).<ref>[http://www.packworld.com/trends-and-issues/trainingeducation/anuga-foodtec-2015-poised-break-records Anuga FoodTec poised break records at Packaging World]</ref>
In 2015, the trade fair achieved a new exhibitor and visitor record. Up 14 percent from the previous fair, 1,496 exhibitors (from 49 countries) exhibited on a total surface area of 129,700 sqm. With regard to trade visitors, 45,604 experts (from 139 countries) represented an increase of 6 percent. International visitors accounted for more than 50 percent of the total.
In 2011 <ref>[http://www.potatopro.com/news/2011/pack-expo-and-anuga-foodtec-announce-strategic-partnership-processing-and-packaging Pack Expo and Anuga FoodTec announce partnership in potatopro]</ref> Anuga FoodTec formed a strategic partnership with [[PMMI]], the organizer of [[Pack Expo]] and [[Expo Pack]] which was renewed in 2015.<ref>[http://www.packagingdigest.com/automation/owners-pack-expo-and-anuga-foodtec-form-strategic-partnership Pack Expo and Anuga FoodTec form strategic partnership in packagingdigest]</ref> In April 2016 Koelnmesse and Fiere di Parma founded a Joint-Venture to commonly organize Cibus Tec, the leading Italian foodtechnology fair. <ref>[http://www.food-magazine.it/2016/06/koeln-parma-exhibitions-sinergia-per-sviluppo-strategico-di-cibus-tec/ Koelnmesse and Fiere di Parma founded JV for Cibus Tec]</ref>
== Range of services == With its process-oriented, cross-sector approach that covers all kinds of raw materials, the Anuga FoodTec provides an overview of the technologies of the entire manufacturing and packaging process in the production of food and drink. The Anuga FoodTec’s range of services is arranged in separate segments:
* Process technology * Filling and packaging technology * Packing materials, packaging, packaging aids * Automation, data processing, controlling/regulation technology * Food safety, quality management * Operating materials, environmental technology, biotechnology * Refrigeration and air-conditioning technology * Conveying, transport and storage installation, logistics * Ingredients, auxiliary materials * Components, assemblies, surface technology, accessories * Service firms, organisations, publishers
== Visitor target groups == The following sectors will be addressed at Anuga FoodTec: * Aromas, essences * Alcoholic beverages * Baby food, health food, food for the elderly * Baked goods * Cereals * Convenience products * Coffee, tea * Cocoa * Delicatessen products * Dairy products (milk, cheese etc.) * Fruit juice, fruit drinks * Fruits, vegetables * Frozen Foods * Halal Products * Ice cream * Kosher Products * Meat, poultry, fish, sausage * Non-Alcoholic beverages * Oil, fats, margarine * Oilseeds * Pet-food * Potatoes * Preserves, pickled products * Powdered soups, pudding powder, other instant products * Pasta * Ready-meals * Spices * Sugar * Starch, ground cereal products * Tobacco products

'''Arthur Shigeru Hara''', {{Post-nominals|country=CAN|OC|OBC}} is a prominent [[Japanese-Canadian]] businessman and philanthropist, renowned for his work in promoting Canada's relations with Pacific Rim nations (especially Japan).
He was born in [[Vancouver]] to Japanese parents. He graduated from [[Britannia Secondary School]] before enrolling at [[Kobe University]]. He joined [[Mitsubishi]] Canada Ltd in 1962 and became the company's first Canadian chairman in 1983.<ref>[http://www.library.ubc.ca/archives/hdcites/hdcites9.html University of British Columbia: The Title and Degree of Doctor of Laws (honoris causa) Conferred at the Congregation, May 29, 1990]</ref>
He was chairman of the Board of Governors of the [[University of British Columbia]] and served as Chairman of the [[Vancouver Board of Trade]] between 1985 and 1986. He was a member of the board of the [[Canadian Unity Council]] and director of Canada West Foundation.<ref>[http://www.cwf.ca/ Canada West Foundation]</ref>
Between 1988 and 1994, he was chairman of the [[Asia Pacific Foundation of Canada]]<ref>[http://www.asiapacific.ca/ Asia Pacific Foundation]</ref> and was a member of the Vancouver Summit Society which prepared the ground for [[APEC]]'s [[Jaggi Singh (activist)#1997_APEC_summit|controversial 1997 summit]] in Vancouver.<ref>[http://www.parl.gc.ca/35/2/parlbus/commbus/senate/Com-e/fore-e/19evb-e.htm?Language=E&Parl=35&Ses=2&comm_id=8 Standing Senate Committee on Foreign Affairs, February 5 1997: Issue 19, Evidence, Afternoon sitting]</ref>
==Honors== He was inducted as a Member of the Order of Canada in 1985 and in 1992 he was promoted to Officer of the Order of Canada.<ref>[http://www.gg.ca/honours/search-recherche/honours-desc.asp?lang=e&TypeID=orc&id=2947 Order of Canada: Arthur S. Hara, O.C., LL.D.]{{dead link|date=October 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He has also been awarded the Canada Confederation Medal, [[Queen Elizabeth II Golden Jubilee Medal]], [[Order of the Rising Sun]], and Honorary Doctor of Laws in 1990. In 2013, he was made a member of the [[Order of British Columbia]] in recognition for being an "Asia-Pacific businessman and economic leader".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newsroom.gov.bc.ca/2013/07/thirteen-to-receive-2013-order-of-british-columbia.html|title=Thirteen to receive 2013 Order of British Columbia}}</ref>

{{Other uses}} [[File:Cabin boy ou mousse 1799.jpg|thumb|Cabin boy, 1799]] A '''cabin boy''' or '''ship's boy''' is a [[boy]] (in the sense of low-ranking young male employee, not always a minor in the juridical sense) who waits on the officers and passengers of a [[ship]],<ref>''Concise Oxford Dictionary'', Oxford University Press 1999, entry "Cabin boy"</ref> especially running errands for the captain. ==Duties== Cabin boys were usually 13–16 years old, but sometimes as young as 8,<ref>https://books.google.es/books?id=cVcAAQAAQBAJ&pg=PA174&lpg=PA174&dq=%22cabin+boys%22+%22as+young+as%22&source=bl&ots=MC1-9kyYDS&sig=iTwIO4e4lfK8JqdQSpY3FdPes_g&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwixmbGyxfDcAhUpLsAKHZ2uDFMQ6AEwDXoECAAQAQ#v=onepage&q=%22cabin%20boys%22%20%22as%20young%20as%22&f=false</ref> and also helped the cook in the [[galley (kitchen)|ship's kitchen]] and carried buckets of food from the ship's kitchen to the [[forecastle]] where the ordinary seamen ate. They would have to run from one end of the ship to the other carrying messages and become familiar with the sails, lines and ropes and the use of each in all sorts of weather. They would have to scramble up the rigging into the yards whenever the sails had to be trimmed. They would occasionally stand watch like other crewmen or act as helmsman in good weather, holding the wheel to keep the ship steady on her course.
==Royal Navy officers== Several prominent British Royal Navy officers began their career as cabin boys. The list includes officers that achieved an admiralty rank before 1801. * Admiral of the Fleet [[Sir William Parker, 1st Baronet of Shenstone]] * Admiral of the Fleet Sir [[Cloudsley Shovell]] * Admiral Sir [[Francis Drake]] * Admiral Sir [[John Hawkins (naval commander)|John Hawkins]] * Admiral (General) [[Richard Deane (regicide)|Richard Deane]] * Admiral (Colonel) [[William Rainsborough]] * Admiral Sir [[William Penn (Royal Navy officer)|William Penn]] * Vice Admiral Lord [[Horatio_Nelson,_1st_Viscount_Nelson|Nelson]] * Vice Admiral Sir [[William Batten]] * Vice Admiral Sir [[John Lawson (naval officer)|John Lawson]] * Vice Admiral (Captain) Badilow * Vice Admiral Sir [[Thomas Tiddeman]] * Vice Admiral (Captain) James Peacock * Vice Admiral (Captain) William Goodson * Vice Admiral Sir [[Christopher Myngs]] * Vice Admiral Sir [[John Harman (Royal Navy officer)|John Harman]] * Rear Admiral Sir [[John Berry (Royal Navy officer)|John Berry]] * Rear Admiral Sir [[Richard Stainer]] * Rear Admiral (Captain) Anthony Houlding * Rear Admiral (Captain) Deacons * Rear Admiral (Captain) Robert Sansum
==Notable cabin boys== *[[John Anglin (Medal of Honor)|John Anglin]], cabin boy who received the [[Medal of Honor]] during the [[American Civil War]]. *[[Hobart Bosworth]], cabin boy on the ''[[Sovereign of the Seas (clipper)|Sovereign of the Seas]]'' who became a famous actor. *[[Christian Franzen]], cabin boy who served in the [[Wisconsin State Assembly]].<ref>'Wisconsin Blue Book 1915,' Biographical Sketch of Chris Franzen, pg. 519</ref> *[[Michael A. Healy|Michael Healy]], cabin boy in 1854, who became the first African-American to command a ship of the United States Government. *[[James Machon]], cabin boy who received the [[Medal of Honor]] during the [[American Civil War]]. *[[Thomas Nickerson]], cabin boy on the ''[[Essex (1799 whaleship)|Essex]]'' who later wrote about the shipwreck and subsequent three months of survival at sea. *[[John H. Paynter]], cabin boy who enlisted in 1884, later became a real estate developer and writer of poetry and nonfiction, including the acclaimed ''Fugitive of the Pearl'' (1930). *[[John Ward Westcott]], cabin boy at the age of 13 and a [[Great Lakes]] captain at 20. He developed a special vessel mail system.
==Popular culture== {{Portal|Nautical}} *''[[Cori, de Scheepsjongen]]'' ("Cori the Cabin Boy"), a comics series by Belgian artist [[Bob de Moor]] about a cabin boy working for the [[Verenigde Oostindische Compagnie]] in the 16th century. *''[[Cabin Boy]]'', a 1994 film. *"Cabin Boy" a song by ''[[Tom Robinson]]'' from the 1984/1997 Castaway Northwest CNWVP006 album ''War Baby''. *''[[Captain Pugwash]]'', a British television children's animated series about a hapless captain and his crew; Tom, the cabin boy, is depicted as the most intelligent member of the crew. It is an [[urban myth]] that he was called 'Roger the cabin boy' (a slang sexual meaning of the name [[Roger]]). *''[[Treasure Island]]'', where the main character Jim serves as a cabin boy on the board the ship the ''Hispaniola''. *"Cabin Boy", a short story by [[Damon Knight]]. *''[[Renaissance Festival]]'', The Cabin Boys, Pirate Fire Comedy act from Minnesota.

{{Other uses|Delivering (disambiguation)}} {{Redirect|Delivery man||The Delivery Man (disambiguation)}} {{More citations needed|date=December 2009}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2016}} [[File:Manila Philippines Pizza-Taxi-in-Makati-Business-District-01.jpg|thumb|250px|[[Pizza delivery]] scooters in the Makati Business District, Manila, Philippines]] '''Delivery''' is the process of transporting goods from a source location to a predefined destination. There are different delivery types. [[Cargo]] (physical goods) are primarily delivered via [[roads]] and [[Rail transport|railroads]] on land, shipping lanes on the sea and [[airline]] networks in the air. Certain specialized goods may be delivered via other networks, such as [[Pipeline transport|pipelines]] for liquid goods, [[power grids]] for electrical power and [[computer networks]] such as the [[Internet]] or [[broadcasting|broadcast]] networks for electronic information.{{cite book | last=Nishio | first=S. | last2=Kishino | first2=F. | title=Advanced Multimedia Content Processing: First International Conference, AMCP'98, Osaka, Japan, November 9-11, 1998, Proceedings | publisher=Springer Berlin Heidelberg | series=Lecture Notes in Computer Science | year=2003 | isbn=978-3-540-48962-7 | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=dQdrCQAAQBAJ&pg=PA196 | page=196}} The general process of delivering goods is known as [[distribution (business)|distribution]]. The study of effective processes for delivery and disposition of goods and personnel is called [[logistics]]. Firms that specialize in delivering commercial goods from point of production or storage to [[point of sale]] are generally known as distributors, while those that specialize in the delivery of goods to the consumer are known as [[Package delivery|delivery services]]. [[Mail|Postal]], [[courier]], and [[relocation services]] also deliver goods for commercial and private interests. ==Consumer goods delivery== [[File:Dairy Crest Milk Float Garage 2.jpg|thumb|right|A [[Dairy Crest]] [[Smith Electric Vehicles|Smiths]] Elizabethan electric [[Milk float]] used to deliver fresh milk to people's doorsteps.]] Most consumer goods are delivered from a point of production ([[factory]] or [[farm]]) through one or more points of storage ([[warehouse]]s) to a point of sale ([[retail store]]), where the consumer buys the good and is responsible for its transportation to point of consumption. There are many variations on this model for specific types of goods and modes of sale. Products sold via catalogue or the Internet may be delivered directly from the manufacturer or warehouse to the consumer's home, or to an [[Packstation|automated delivery booth]]. Small manufacturers may deliver their products directly to retail stores without warehousing. Some manufacturers maintain [[factory outlet]]s which serve as both warehouse and retail store, selling products directly to consumers at wholesale prices (although many retail stores falsely advertise as factory outlets). Building, construction, landscaping and like materials are generally delivered to the consumer by a contractor as part of another service. Some highly perishable or hazardous goods, such as [[radioisotopes]] used in [[medical imaging]], are delivered directly from manufacturer to consumer. Home delivery is often available for [[fast food]] and other convenience products, e.g. [[pizza delivery]].{{cite book | last=Haig | first=M. | title=Brand Royalty: How the World's Top 100 Brands Thrive & Survive | publisher=Kogan Page | series=Kogan Page Series | year=2006 | isbn=978-0-7494-4826-4 | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=f4AJ0AU58a4C&pg=PA277 | page=277}} Sometimes home delivery of [[supermarket]] goods is possible.{{cite book | last=Hill | first=C.W.L. | last2=Jones | first2=G.R. | last3=Schilling | first3=M.A. | title=Strategic Management: Theory & Cases: An Integrated Approach | publisher=Cengage Learning | year=2014 | isbn=978-1-305-14272-5 | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=d0PAAgAAQBAJ&pg=SL3-PA59 | page=3-PA59}} A milk float is a small [[battery electric vehicle]] (BEV), specifically designed for the delivery of fresh [[milk]]. A new form of delivery is emerging on the horizon of the internet age: Delivery by the crowd e.g. crowd delivery. In this concept an individual not necessarily contracted by the vendor performs the delivery of goods to the destination. Sometimes, private [[courier]] companies will also deliver [[consumer goods]] on a regular basis for companies like [[E-commerce]] businesses. ==Delivery vehicles== {{See also|Autonomous car}} [[File:An ASDA Mercedes Benz Sprinter delivery van.jpg|thumb|right|[[Asda|ASDA]] [[Mercedes-Benz Sprinter]] vans for delivering groceries to customers' doors]] [[File:Worksman delivery trike.jpg|thumb|Delivery tricycle]] [[File:Commercial. Elmhurst Dairy BAnQ P48S1P07599.jpg|thumb|A horse-drawn dairy delivery vehicle in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]], Canada in 1942]] The consumer demand for Supermarkets to deliver to their door created the need for a mixed temperature controlled vehicle on 3.5T chassis. These vehicle bodies were initially built with the traditional GRP sandwich panels but as more damage resistant lightweight materials with better insulation properties have become available companies have been developing Advanced Home Delivery Vehicles. The 2012 Commercial Vehicle Show in the UK saw the new JDC PolyBilt design, one of the latest of these "Plastic" bodies that can also be recycled at the end of its service life unlike the traditional GRP which ends up as landfill. Vehicles are often specialized to deliver different types of goods. On land, [[semi-trailer]]s are outfitted with various [[trailer (vehicle)|trailers]] such as box trailers, flatbeds, car carriers, tanks and other specialized trailers, while [[railroad]] [[trains]] include similarly specialized cars. [[Armored car (valuables)|Armored cars]], [[dump truck]]s and [[concrete mixer]]s are examples of vehicles specialized for delivery of specific types of goods. On the sea, [[merchant ships]] come in various forms, such as [[cargo ship]]s, [[oil tankers]] and [[fishing boat]]s. [[Freight aircraft]] are used to deliver cargo. Often, [[passenger]] vehicles are used for delivery of goods. These include [[buses]], [[van]]s, [[Pickup truck|pick-ups]], [[Automobile|cars]] (e.g., for mail or pizza delivery), [[motorcycles]] and [[bicycles]] (e.g., for newspaper delivery). A significant amount of freight is carried in the cargo holds of passenger ships and aircraft. Everyday travelers, known as a [[casual courier]], can also be used to deliver goods. Delivery to remote, primitive or inhospitable areas may be accomplished using [[general aviation|small aircraft]], [[snowmobiles]], [[horse-drawn vehicle]]s, [[dog sled]]s, [[pack animal]]s, on foot, or by a variety of other transport methods. ==Periodic deliveries== Some products are delivered to consumers on a periodic schedule.{{cite book | last=Golden | first=B.L. | last2=Raghavan | first2=S. | last3=Wasil | first3=E.A. | title=The Vehicle Routing Problem: Latest Advances and New Challenges | publisher=Springer US | series=Operations Research/Computer Science Interfaces Series | year=2008 | isbn=978-0-387-77778-8 | url=https://books.google.com/books?id=-3ta5ne3-owC&pg=PA93 | page=93}} Historically, home delivery of many goods was much more common in urban centres of the developed world. At the beginning of the 20th century, perishable farm items such as milk, eggs and ice, were delivered weekly or even daily to customers by local farms. [[Milkmen]] delivered milk and other farm produce. With the advent of home refrigeration and better distribution methods, these products are today largely delivered through the same retail distribution systems as other food products. [[Iceman (occupation)|Icemen]] delivered ice for [[iceboxes]] until the popularization of home refrigerator rendered them obsolete in most places. Similarly, laundry was once picked up and washed at a commercial [[laundry]] before being delivered to middle-class homes until the appearance of the [[washing machine]] and [[Clothes dryer|dryer]] (the lower classes washed their own and the upper classes had live-in servants). Likewise deliveries of coal and wood for home heating were more common until they were replaced in many areas by [[natural gas]], oil, or electric heating.{{cite web|url=http://www.rewedmonton.ca/content_view_rew?CONTENT_ID=2786|title=The days of door-to-door delivery|date=11 March 2010|last=Herzog|first=Lawrence|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120308202349/http://www.rewedmonton.ca/content_view_rew?CONTENT_ID=2786|archive-date=8 March 2012|work=Edmonton Real Estate Weekly: It's Our Heritage|volume=28|issue=10}} Some products, most notably [[home heating oil]], are still delivered periodically. Human blood may be delivered to hospitals on a periodic schedule. Milk delivery continued until the mid-twentieth century across North America. For example, the last milk delivery by horse-and-wagon in [[Edmonton]] was in 1961.{{cite web|url=http://www.epl.ca/infofile-detail?subject_detail=Milk%20Delivery%20-%20Edmonton|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120829062550/http://www.epl.ca/infofile-detail?subject_detail=Milk%20Delivery%20-%20Edmonton|archive-date=29 August 2012|title=Infofile Detail - Milk Delivery - Edmonton| publisher=Edmonton Public Library}} [[Milkman joke]]s continue in circulation long after. Related lines of [[Jeannie C. Riley]]'s 1968 hit song "[[Harper Valley PTA]]" say:
''There's old Bobby Taylor sitting there, and seven times he's asked me for a date,
And Mrs. Taylor sure seems to use a lot of ice whenever he's away.''

He serves as Chairman and Managing Director of [[Assore Limited]] ({{JSE|ASR}}).
==Early life== Desmond Sacco was born in [[Johannesburg]], South Africa.<ref name="rocksandminerals">Bruce Cairncross, [http://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/00357529.2012.708615?journalCode=vram20#.U1eS-FdBYpQ The Mineral Collection of Desmond Sacco, Johannesburg, South Africa], ''[[Rocks & Minerals]]'', Volume 87, Issue 5, 2012, pp. 410-417</ref> His father, [[Guido Sacco]], founded the Assore Group in 1928.<ref name="rocksandminerals"/><ref name="forbes">{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/desmond-sacco/|title=Desmond Sacco|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-01-11|language=en}}</ref><ref>[http://www.miningweekly.com/article/two-maestros-of-manganese-2000-04-07 Two maestros of manganese], ''[[Mining Weekly]]'', April 7, 2000</ref><ref name="janemarais">Jane Marais, [http://www.timeslive.co.za/business/2010/12/04/the-billionaires-are-back The Billionaires are back], ''[[The Times (South Africa)|The Times]]'', December 04, 2010</ref> He received a Bachelor of Science in Geology from the [[University of South Africa]], where he played cricket and hockey.<ref name="forbes"/><ref name="bloomberg">{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/markets/stocks|title=Stocks|website=Bloomberg.com|access-date=2018-01-11}}</ref><ref name="assore">{{Cite web|url=http://www.assore.com/financials/2013annualreport/?page_id=267#&panel1-1|title=Board of directors {{!}} Assore|website=www.assore.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-01-11}}</ref>
==Career== In 1968, Sacco joined the Assore Group, a public company traded on the [[Johannesburg Stock Exchange]] founded by his father four decades earlier.<ref name="forbes"/><ref name="assore"/> He was appointed to its Board of Directors in 1974, and has served as its Chairman and Managing Director since 1992.<ref name="forbes"/><ref name="assore"/> He also serves as Chairman of [[Assmang Limited]].<ref name="bloomberg"/><ref>[http://www.assmang.co.za/executive.asp Assmang Board of Directors]</ref>
Sacco is a fellow of the [[Institute of Directors]] and the [[Geological Society of South Africa]].<ref name="bloomberg"/><ref name="assore"/>
Sacco is worth US$1.15 billion.<ref name="forbes"/>
===Personal life=== Sacco resides in his hometown of Johannesburg.<ref name="forbes"/> He is married, and has two children.<ref name="forbes"/>

'''Dubai Design District''' ('''d3''') is a purpose-built master-plan development in Dubai dedicated to the design community including startups, entrepreneurs and established international design, luxury and fashion brands. It is a [[TECOM Group]] [[List of Free Trade Zones in the United Arab Emirates|freezone]] business park consisting of three phases, the first of which is 11 building offices, completed in 2015.
d3's facilities will include residential, hospitality, retail and office space. The development will include a 1.8 km waterfront development which will be populated with food and beverage outlets, hotels, retail outlets and a multi-use outdoor space.
d3 is located close to [[Mohammed bin Rashid City]] and adjacent to Dubai's [[Business Bay]]. The district is situated beside [[Dubai Creek]], and behind [[Burj Khalifa]] and [[Dubai Mall]].<ref name="attract">{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/architecture/can-dubais-design-district-hipster-village-attract-the-right-type-of-goateewearing-individualist-10277373.html|title=Can Dubai's Design District 'hipster village' attract the right type|date=2015-05-26|work=The Independent|access-date=2018-05-30|language=en-GB}}</ref>
Dr Amina Al Rustimani is CEO of the development company behind d3.<ref>http://vision.ae/articles/moving_forward_dubai_fashion</ref>
==Phases== Development of d3 has been separated into three phases.
===Phase 1=== Phase 1 was completed in 2015, with 1.2m sq. ft. of offices, studios, ateliers, showrooms, and over 200,000 sq. ft. of retail space.
It contains 11 buildings with an estimated 100 retail units and 1,000 office units.
===Phase 2=== Phase 2 will see the construction of the creative community which will house a range of design industry workshops, studios and showrooms. This phase is due for completion in 2019. The creative community is being designed by [[Foster and Partners]].<ref name=gulfcon>{{cite web | url = http://www.fosterandpartners.com/news/archive/2015/05/dubai-design-district-awards/ | title = Dubai Design District Awards Foster + Partners to Design Phase 2 of its master plan | date = 5 May 2015 | publisher = Foster & Partners | accessdate=26 May 2015}}</ref>
===Phase 3=== The third phase of the development will focus on d3's 2 km long Creek side promenade which will feature hotels, international and regional food and beverage offerings with a wide selection of hospitality and leisure facilities. This phase is due for completion in 2018.<ref name="attract"/>

AppBoard | homepage = [http://www.edge-technologies.com/ www.edge-technologies.com] }} '''Edge Technologies, Inc.''' is an [[United States|American]] software company, focusing on the integration of secure [[web applications]]. Edge provides software products and enterprise services to corporations and government agencies. Edge was founded in 1993 and is headquartered in [[Reston, Virginia]]. In 2017, the company was acquired by Lotus Innovations Fund.{{cite web |url = http://www.prweb.com/releases/2016/12/prweb13950271.htm |title = Lotus Innovations Acquires Edge Technologies, Inc. |accessdate= 2017-02-20 |publisher = PRWeb}} ==Edge Summary== Company Background *Founded in 1993 *Corporate headquarters located in Reston, Virginia *The company sells its products worldwide through a direct sales force, distributors, value-added resellers and system integrators. ===Company Facts=== *Holds a technology patent awarded in 2007 for "Secure Portal-Based Information Display and Consolidation Technology" *Developed enVision, the first software product to provide a web interface for [[HP Openview]] and [[Network Node Manager]]. ==Products== * (Released in 2000) enPortal is a secure, integration [[Web portal]]. It lets service providers or large enterprise customers view data from disparate network-management systems through a single Web interface.{{cite web |url = http://www.informationweek.com/791/we2.htm |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20121017190752/http://www.informationweek.com/791/we2.htm |dead-url = yes |archive-date = 2012-10-17 |title = New Monitoring Products Keep Service Providers In Mind |accessdate= 2017-02-20 |publisher = InformationWeek}} The enPortal customer base is primarily corporations and government agencies which use network management applications. enPortal offers prepackaged Product Integration Modules (PIMs). PIMs provide pre-built integration with commonly used applications, including products from Concord Communications, [[Hewlett-Packard]], InfoVista, [[IBM Tivoli Framework|IBM/Tivoli Netcool]], and [[Remedy Corp|Remedy]]. [[Single Sign-On]] allows the user to log into enPortal, which then automatically logs into all of the other applications integrated into the portal. The software also can automate workflow, normalize and correlate events, and take action based on user-defined rules.{{cite web |url=http://www.networkworld.com/article/2338534/software/vendors-look-to-pool-management-data.html |title=Vendors Look to Pool Management Data |accessdate=2017-02-20 |publisher=NetworkWorld}} * (Released in 2008) AppBoard is a data integration/data visualization platform that allows for the rapid development and deployment of real-time business systems dashboards. AppBoard consists of a series of Data Adapters, Widgets, and a dashboard Builder. In 2012, Edge released mobile versions of the AppBoard client for Android and iOS in conjunction with the version 2.2 release of AppBoard. * (Released in 2017) edgeSuite is a data integration and data visualization platform that aims to provide efficient development and deployment of real-time business systems dashboards. edgeCore allows to connect, visualize, and interact with data in a user-friendly manner. edgeWeb allows to integrate web-based interfaces. It is multi-platform. ==See also== * [[Single sign-on]] * [[Java Portlet specification]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.edge-technologies.com Edge Official Website] *[http://patft.uspto.gov/netacgi/nph-Parser?Sect2=PTO1&Sect2=HITOFF&p=1&u=%2Fnetahtml%2FPTO%2Fsearch-bool.html&r=1&f=G&l=50&d=PALL&RefSrch=yes&Query=PN%2F7269625 Patent] [[Category:Software companies based in Virginia]] [[Category:Companies based in Reston, Virginia]] [[Category:Companies based in Virginia]] [[Category:Companies established in 1993]] [[Category:Business software]]

'''Emil Calmanovici''' (March 1896 – March 12, 1956) was a [[Romania]]n engineer, businessman, and [[communism|communist]] militant. Known for the financial support he gave to the [[Romanian Communist Party]] (PCR) during the late 1930s and early 1940s, he became a [[political prisoner]] of the [[Communist Romania|Communist regime]] after being implicated in the [[show trial]] of his collaborator [[Lucreţiu Pătrăşcanu]]. Calmanovici died in mysterious circumstances in [[Aiud prison]], while on recovery from a [[hunger strike]].
==Biography==
=== Early life and financial success === Born to a [[History of the Jews in Romania|Jewish]] family in [[Piatra Neamţ]], he was the son of Mendel and his wife Ana, who ran a business in the town.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința">Betea, "Recunoștința..."</ref> A graduate of the [[Ludwig Maximilians University of Munich|University of Munich]] and the [[Humboldt University of Berlin|University of Berlin]], where he was confronted with the establishment of the [[Nazi Germany|Nazi regime]]<ref name="Betea, Procese politice">Betea, "Procese politice"</ref> and became an avid reader of [[Karl Marx]] and [[Vladimir Lenin]],<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> he also amassed a fortune in his youth, owing to his [[real estate]] investments.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> Calmanovici decided to dedicate his wealth to the PCR cause, at a time when the party was outlawed.<ref name="ReferenceA">Betea, "Recunoștința...", "Testamentul..."</ref>
By the end of [[World War II]], when they were [[nationalization|nationalized]], his properties included two construction enterprises, additional shares in a [[logging]] company centered in his native town, seven apartments, and over 18,000 m² in [[Bucharest]] real estate.<ref>Betea, "procese politice", "Recunoștința..."</ref>
===Party financier=== According to Calmanovici's statements, he had contributed massive sums to various PCR enterprises between 1937 (the year when he joined the group) and 1944, being responsible for the purchase of a [[printing press]], the renovation of the [[Central Committee]] seat in Bucharest, a clandestine radio station, and a kindergarten for children of party members.<ref name="ReferenceB">Calmanovici, in Betea, "Recunoștința..."</ref> He estimated that his investments totaled 30 million [[Romanian leu|lei]] in 1942 currency, which he argued was over 75% of his total income.<ref name="ReferenceB"/> Calmanovici took pride in noting that this contribution was by far the highest of all those recorded (including that of [[Jacques Berman]]).<ref name="ReferenceB"/> In addition, he contended, nationalization of his wealth had brought the state over 1 billion lei in 1947 currency.<ref name="ReferenceB"/>
Inside the PCR, he kept only sporadic contacts with the "prison faction", a group led by [[Gheorghe Gheorghiu-Dej]] (according to one account, during the time when Gheorghiu-Dej was held in [[Doftana prison]], Calmanovici sent him a jacket as a gift).<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> Instead, he was close to Pătrășcanu's maverick group (later known as the "Secretariat faction"), a fact which, in time, contributed to his arrest and imprisonment (both of which were instigated by members of the "prison faction").<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/>
===Late 1940s=== During the war, when Romania joined the [[Axis Powers]] and participated in [[Operation Barbarossa]], he was among those charged with establishing contacts between the Communists and other opposition groups.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> At the time, his relation with the pro-[[Allies of World War II|Allied]] financier Alexandru Ștefănescu helped him gain intimate knowledge of various negotiations between the [[National Peasants' Party]] (PNȚ) and the [[National Liberal Party (Romania, 1875)|National Liberal Party]] (PNL) on one side and [[Ion Antonescu]]'s dictatorial government on the other, as well as of the latter's tentative moves to withdraw Romania from its alliance with [[Nazi Germany]] through a compromise with the Western Allies (the 1943 unsuccessful mission of [[Barbu Ştirbey]] to [[Cairo]]).<ref name="ReferenceC">Betea, "Recunoștința..."; note to Calmanovici's letter, in ''Sfera Politicii''</ref> Calmanovici forwarded his information to the PCR's [[Remus Koffler]], which helped the group approach and influence the PNȚ leader [[Iuliu Maniu]] to form an alliance against Antonescu (one which enlisted support from the [[Soviet Union]]).<ref name="ReferenceC"/>
After the fall of Antonescu's regime and the onset of [[Soviet occupation of Romania|Soviet occupation]] in August 1944, when the PCR first entered government, Calmanovici became an esteemed party member and officially endorsed industrialist.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> In the spring of 1945, his Bucharest house served as a meeting place for PCR and pro-Communist forces who planned and succeeded in toppling [[List of Prime Ministers of Romania|Prime Minister]] [[Nicolae Rădescu]]<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> (after a series of street clashes, Rădescu was replaced with the [[Ploughmen's Front]] leader [[Petru Groza]], whose cabinet was controlled by the PCR). Following this, he was appointed a technical director of the Bucharest Constructions Institute and was involved in enforcing Soviet standards and expertise.<ref>Betea, "Procese politice", "Recunoștința..."</ref>
===Arrest=== Relations between Calmanovici and the PCR degenerated abruptly toward the end of the 1940s, and he was arrested by the [[Securitate]] on May 26, 1951.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> Several days earlier, Calmanovici had met with [[Constantin Pîrvulescu]]. At this meeting, Calmanovici asked Pîrvulescu to use his status as head of the Party Control Commission to grant him a decoration (Calmanovici was stiffly refused, on the grounds that such self-promotion was unprecedented).<ref name="ReferenceB"/>
Documents involving the 1943–1944 contacts between Calmanovici, Pătrășcanu, Koffler, and Maniu (who was already imprisoned on such charges following the [[Tămădău Affair]]) were interpreted as evidence that the former two had been spying for the Western Allies.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> In full, the accusation read: "as an agent of the [[United Kingdom|English]] espionage services he forwarded information about the PCR, taking part in the criminal action to destroy the party and support the [[Eastern Front (World War II)|anti-Soviet war]]".<ref name="ReferenceD">Rendered in Betea, "Recunoștința..."</ref>
Calmanovici stated that, early on, authorities had presented him with the claim that he was kept in custody in order to aid in the process of compiling a history of the PCR.<ref>Calmanovici, in Betea, "Procese politice", "Recunoștința..."</ref> Starting in summer 1951, he was subject to a series of Securitate interrogations, which concluded that he had not contributed to hostile activities and that he was able to support his case with "sufficient guarantees".<ref name="ReferenceD"/>
In December, Calmanovici, who had devoted his spare time to learning [[Russian language|Russian]],<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> was supposed to be released from custody.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> Instead, his case was reviewed by a new group of Securitate officials, who obeyed Gheorghiu-Dej and alleged that the latter's rival, [[List of Romanian Ministers of the Interior|Minister of the Interior]] [[Teohari Georgescu]], was not enforcing party doctrine (Georgescu was to be himself ousted in 1952).<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> On orders from [[Alexandru Drăghici]] and [[Vladimir Mazuru]], under the supervision of several Soviet envoys,<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> Securitate cadres were to induce Calmanovici to confess having spied in Romania during and after the World War.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> The officer who had originally argued in favor of his release was criticized for having displayed "lack of vigilance", and ordered to resume interrogation.<ref>Betea, "Recunoștința..."; Golopenția</ref>
In several appeals to the PCR leadership (Gheorghiu-Dej, Pîrvulescu, [[Chivu Stoica]], [[Emil Bodnăraş]] and others) Calmanovici repeatedly stated his innocence and dismissed accusations that he was a [[bourgeoisie|bourgeois]] figure with insufficient political education.<ref name="ReferenceB"/> In another personal letter, he compared allegations of espionage with those made by [[Alexander Kerensky]] about [[Vladimir Lenin]] prior to the [[October Revolution]] in [[Russia]].<ref name="ReferenceE">Calmanovici, in ''Sfera Politicii''</ref>
===Confession and trial=== In February 1953, Calmanovici gave in to Securitate violence and presented operatives with a fabricated account, stating that he had been part of a network of spies presided over by Milton (a name he came up with after recalling the 17th-century poet [[John Milton]]).<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> His inquisitors soon rejected the story, and argued that it was additional proof of "provocation" on Calmanovici's part.<ref name="ReferenceD"/>
Eventually, he agreed to sign his name to a confession drawn up by the PCR, in return for a promise that he was to be given at most a four-year sentence.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> It has been argued that the document endorsed by Calmanovici was directly inspired from the similar one handed over by [[Nikolai Bukharin]] during the 1938 [[Moscow]] [[Trial of the Twenty One]].<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> In its final form, it also incriminated Calmanovici of [[Zionism]] and spying in favor of the [[Western Bloc|Western Allies]] (the [[United States]],<ref name="Betea, Procese politice"/> or, alternatively, the [[United Kingdom]]).<ref name="Introduction to Calmgram">Introduction to Calmgram</ref>
Consequently, Calmanovici was indicted in Pătrășcanu's 1954 trial, where, despite early promises, the court ultimately sentenced him to [[life imprisonment]] and [[Penal labour|forced labor]].<ref>Betea, "Recunoștința..."; Levy, p.152; Tismăneanu, p.329</ref> The sentence was given on counts of [[crime against peace]] and [[high treason]].<ref name="Introduction to Calmgram"/> As Pătrășcanu and Koffler were being swiftly executed in [[Jilava]], he and the other persons sentenced (including Alexandru Ștefănescu, [[Petre Pandrea]], [[Harry Brauner]], [[Lena Constante]], and Pătrășcanu's wife Elena) were dispatched to the infamous [[Aiud prison]], on their way to various facilities.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/>
===Imprisonment and death=== Calmanovici, who was kept in almost complete isolation, managed to contact other inmates, an infraction which was added to his criminal record.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/>
As a consequence, the Securitate decided to stage a set of circumstances which were to incriminate him further: in 1955, Calmanovici was escorted out of Aiud and into a villa in [[Săftica]], where he received a humane treatment while being interrogated by [[Vasile Posteucă]].<ref>Betea, "Recunoștința..."; Calmanovici, in ''Sfera Politicii''</ref> A guard was instructed to approach him and earn his confidence, to the point where Calmanovici trusted him with carrying out a message he had written on linens; addressed to his former employees and meant to be forwarded to Jewish communists in the [[Western world]], these exposed the fallacies and major irregularities of his trial.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> (In similar appeals, Calmanovici had also meant to bring his case to the attention of the [[Cominform]].)<ref name="ReferenceE"/> After the guard handed the letters over to his superiors, Calmanovici was chained and moved back into Aiud.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/>
He decided to publicize his innocence by beginning a [[hunger strike]], which eventually led physicians on duty to [[Force-feeding|force-feed]] him.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> His diet at the time went against medical guidelines for people with [[malnutrition]], and was the most likely cause of his death by [[gastrointestinal perforation]] — two prison staff members later attested that this was done on purpose, as a method of assassination.<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/> It has also been noted that Calmanovici's signed statement according to which he was abandoning the hunger strike and was accepting the treatment, extracted only hours before his death, was immediately communicated to higher authority (unlike any other such statement of the time).<ref name="ReferenceA"/>
Of his group, Calmanovici was the only one to die in custody (all others were released ca. 1964, when they benefited from an [[amnesty]]).<ref>Levy, p.152</ref>
==Rehabilitation and legacy== Like all defendants in the Pătrășcanu trial, Calmanovici was [[Rehabilitation (Soviet)|rehabilitated]] in April 1968 by [[Nicolae Ceauşescu]], following a change in policy which was meant to discredit his deceased predecessor Gheorghiu-Dej and the former Securitate chief [[Alexandru Drăghici]].<ref name="ReferenceB"/>
The new inquiry, overseen by [[Ion Popescu-Puţuri]], found that Calmanovici had been the victim of systematic abuse. Among others, it was established that Calmanovici's arrest had been operated on the basis of Gheorghiu-Dej's personal views, that the charges had for long not been communicated to Calmanovici, that Soviet agents had openly intervened in interrogations, and that, like virtually all other defendants, he had been repeatedly beaten and otherwise [[torture]]d to ensure a [[forced confession]].<ref name="Betea, Recunoștința"/>
Calmanovici's son became a resident and later a citizen of [[Sweden]], becoming known under the name Gad Calmgran.<ref name="Introduction to Calmgram"/> He worked as a journalist, and was a collaborator for the newspaper ''[[Dagens Nyheter]]''.<ref name="Introduction to Calmgram"/>

{{spanish name|Luksic|Craig}} '''Guillermo Luksic Craig''' (1956–2013) was a [[Chile]]an heir and businessman.<ref name="guillermoforbes">[https://www.forbes.com/profile/guillermo-craig/ Forbes: Guillermo Luksic Craig]</ref><ref name="quinienco">[http://www.quinenco.cl/gobierno/directores.html Quiñenco Board of Directors] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130218182923/http://www.quinenco.cl/gobierno/directores.html |date=2013-02-18 }}</ref>
==Biography==
===Early life=== His late father was [[Andrónico Luksic Abaroa|Andrónico Luksic]] (1926–2005), founder of [[Luksic Group]], including [[Antofagasta PLC]], [[Minera Los Pelambres]], [[Minera Michilla]] and [[Minera El Tesoro]], and his mother is [[Ena Craig]].<ref name="craze">Matt Craze, [https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-10-05/chile-s-richest-family-risks-golden-touch-with-shipping-purchase-freight.html Chile’s Richest Family Risks Golden Touch With Shipping Purchase: Freight], ''[[Bloomberg BusinessWeek]]'', October 5, 2011</ref><ref name="irisfontbona">[https://www.forbes.com/profile/iris-fontbona/ Forbes: Iris Fontbona]</ref> He was an heir to the wealthiest family in Chile, worth an estimated US$17.4 billion as of March 2013.<ref name="craze"/><ref name="irisfontbona"/> His brother [[Jean-Paul Luksic Fontbona]] is chairman of [[Antofagasta PLC]] ({{lse|ANTO}}).<ref name="businessweek">[http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=767556&ticker=ANTO:LN Bloomberg BusinessWeek: Jean-Paul Luksic Fontbona]</ref>

[[File:Henk Bruna.jpg|thumb|Henk Bruna]] '''Henk Bruna''' (11 June 1916 – 22 February 2008) was a Dutch publisher and director of the stationery and bookstore chain [[Bruna (company)|Bruna]]. He was a brother of A.W. (Abs) Bruna (1902–1996) and an uncle of the artist [[Dick Bruna]].<ref>{{nl}} [http://www.ed.nl/edeconomie/article2718806.ece Henk Bruna overleden], Eindhovens Dagblad, 27 February 2008</ref>
From 1935 till 1982 Bruna was director of his own publishing and stationery and bookstore chain.<ref>{{nl}} {{cite web|url=http://www.wereldomroep.nl/news/zijlijn/5658613/Henk-Bruna-oprichter-Brunawinkels-overleden |title=Henk Bruna, oprichter Bruna-winkels, overleden |accessdate=2011-10-18 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080606185712/http://www.wereldomroep.nl/news/zijlijn/5658613/Henk-Bruna-oprichter-Brunawinkels-overleden |archivedate=June 6, 2008 |df= }}, [[Radio Netherlands Worldwide]], 26 February 2008</ref>
He also was founder of the Dutch branch of the [[Round Table (club)|Round Table]], an international [[men's club]]. He began the ''Nederlandsche Tafelronde'' (the first Dutch Round Table) on 7 June 1946 in his city of birth Utrecht. In 1949 he became honorary member of the ''Nederlandsche Tafelronde'' and also after his 40th birthday at the age where one has to leave the club he remained concerned with the club.<ref>{{nl}} {{cite web|url=http://www.roundtable.nl/nieuws/ |title=Henk Bruna (1916-2008) |accessdate=2011-10-18 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090327061634/http://www.roundtable.nl/nieuws/ |archivedate=March 27, 2009 |df= }}, Press statement on roundtable.nl, 25 February 2008 (archive)</ref> Bruna also was President of the ''Boekverkooperscollegie Eendragt'' (Bookseller's College Eendragt) from 1947 till 1980 and because his great accomplishments for this society he became Honorary President in 1980.
Bruna died in Huis ter Heide at the age of 91 years.

[[New Zealand National Party|National]] (1938-66) }} '''Hiram Hunter''' (10 February 1874 – 9 May 1966) was a New Zealand politician and trade unionist. ==Early life== Born in [[Christchurch]] in 1874, Hunter was a [[farmer]], storekeeper, carter, and [[trade unionist]].{{DNZB|McAloon|Jim |3h46|Hunter, Hiram - Biography|2 November 2012}} ==Political career== Hunter stood for the [[Christchurch East]] electorate in the [[New Zealand House of Representatives]] in {{NZ election link year|1911}} for the [[New Zealand Labour Party (1910)|Labour Party (original)]], {{NZ election link year|1914}} for the [[Social Democratic Party (New Zealand)|Social Democratic Party]] and {{NZ election link year|1919}} for the [[New Zealand Labour Party]]. His best result was losing by 136 votes in 1911 in a close three-way contest, and failing to qualify for the subsequent [[Two-round system|run-off election]] by just four votes. He was President of the LRC{{Clarify|date=June 2013}} (1911–1913) and of the Social Democratic Party (1913–1915). In {{NZ election link year|1931}}, he contested the [[Mid-Canterbury (New Zealand electorate)|Mid-Canterbury]] electorate as an [[Independent Labour]] candidate against [[Jeremiah Connolly]], but was unsuccessful.{{sfn|Gustafson|1980|p=159}} During the 1930s, Hunter became increasingly disillusioned with the NZ Labour Party and argued that: ''"We have learned much of socialisation through its application in Russia. The result has been servility for the workers under the domination of dictators and, what seemed a book of beautiful ideal in 1915 has turned out to be in practice, a horrible reality"''.(The Christchurch Press, 6 October 1938) In 1938 he stood for the conservative [[New Zealand National Party|National Party]] against his former Labour comrade [[Dan Sullivan (New Zealand politician)|Dan Sullivan]] who beat him by a three to one margin, with the election-night crowd booing him so loudly his speech could not be heard leaving Hunter with an undignified end to his public career. Hiram Hunter was a member of the [[Christchurch City Council]] for ten years (1911–1915; 1917–1923).{{cite web |url= http://www1.ccc.govt.nz/handbook/councillorsofthecityofchristchurch.asp| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20110720010657/http://www1.ccc.govt.nz/handbook/councillorsofthecityofchristchurch.asp | archivedate = 20 July 2011 |title=Councillors of the City of Christchurch |publisher=Christchurch City Council|accessdate=2 November 2012 |location=Christchurch}} ==Death== Hunter died in 1966 at [[Ashburton, New Zealand|Ashburton]]. ==Notes== {{Reflist|30em}} '''Oyindamola Honey Ogundeyi''' is the founder of Fashpa.com, a [[Nigeria|Nigerian]] e-commerce site that designs and sells its products online and in store and also sells fashion and lifestyle brands from the international market to Nigerians.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Nsehe |first1=Mfonobong |title=10 Emerging Women Entrepreneurs To Watch In Africa |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/mfonobongnsehe/2014/09/11/10-emerging-women-entrepreneurs-to-watch-in-africa/#50fa50123443 |accessdate=5 July 2018 |publisher=Forbes |date=11 September 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=BellaNaija Style |title=Fashpa debuts new holiday campaign with Dija, the 'forget me not' collection |url=https://www.bellanaija.com/2016/12/fashpa-debuts-new-holiday-campaign-with-dija-the-forget-me-not-collection/ |accessdate=5 July 2018 |publisher=Bella Naija |date=16 December 2016}}</ref> She launched an entrepreneurial [[vlog]] ''Side Hustle to Empire'' in 2017 where she gives tips on how she started and runs her business.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://onobello.com/side-hustle-to-empire-fasphas-ceo-honey-ogundeyi-debuts-entrepreneurial-vlog-watch-episodes-1-3/|title=“Side Hustle to Empire”! Faspha’s CEO Honey Ogundeyi Debuts Entrepreneurial Vlog {{!}} Watch Episodes 1-3! - OnoBello.com|website=onobello.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-07-06}}</ref>
== Education == She started her secondary education at [[Queen's College, Lagos|Queens College Yaba]], Lagos and finished her secondary education in [[Alexandra College]] in [[Dublin|Dublin, Ireland]]. She then proceeded to the [[University of Birmingham]] and graduated with a [[Bachelor of Science|BSc]] in Public Policy and Management.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://live.worldbank.org/experts/oyindamola-honey-ogundeyi|title=Oyindamola Honey Ogundeyi|date=2018-04-12|work=World Bank Live|access-date=2018-07-06|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Oyebade |first1=Wole |title=Entrepreneurship thrives better when you fulfil a need – Oyindamola Ogundeyi |url=https://guardian.ng/business-services/entrepreneurship-thrives-better-when-you-fulfil-a-need-oyindamola-honey-ogundeyi/amp/ |accessdate=5 July 2018 |publisher=Guardian Nigeria (online) |date=14 July 2017}}</ref>
== Career == Ogundeyi was an associate with [[United Bank for Africa|UBA Group]] from 2004 to 2006. She later worked for companies including [[McKinsey & Company]], where she worked in consulting in [[Brussels]] and [[Johannesburg]]. After her spell with McKinsey & Company, she worked with [[Ericsson]] as Head of Brand Management for [[Sub-Saharan Africa]] and then proceeded to [[Google]] as an Industry Manager.<ref name=":0" />
Ogundeyi launched Fashpa.com in April 2014. She founded the company after she was unable to get shoes she wanted from [[Balogun Market]] in Lagos Island, Nigeria.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Gaffey |first1=Conor |title=NIGERIAN STARTUP FASHPA REVOLUTIONIZES HOW WEST AFRICANS BUY CLOTHES |url=http://www.newsweek.com/fashpa-nigeria-honey-ogundeyi-525850 |accessdate=5 July 2018 |publisher=Newsweek |date=30 November 2016}}</ref>
== Awards and recognition == In 2016, Ogundeyi was listed by the [[World Economic Forum]] as one of the top 10 innovators in Africa as well 10 most influential young Nigerians under 40 in Technology. In 2014, she was listed by [[Forbes]] as one of the Top 10 women emerging entrepreneurs to watch in Africa. She has also been recognised as a [[One Young World]] Ambassador representing Nigeria.<ref>{{cite news |last1=WEF |title=Africa’s Top Women Innovators Take the Stage in Kigali |url=https://www.weforum.org/press/2016/05/africa-s-top-women-innovators-take-the-stage-in-kigali/ |accessdate=6 July 2018 |agency=World Economic Forum |date=11 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1=Nsehe |first1=Mfonobong |title=10 Emerging Women Entrepreneurs To Watch In Africa |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/mfonobongnsehe/2014/09/11/10-emerging-women-entrepreneurs-to-watch-in-africa/amp/ |accessdate=6 July 2018 |agency=Forbes |publisher=Forbes.com |date=11 September 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.oneyoungworld.com/profile-main/32575|title=Honey Ogundeyi|work=One Young World|access-date=2018-07-06|language=en}}</ref>

{{Infobox person | name = Hubert Looser | image = Hubert_Looser.jpg | caption = Art collector Hubert Looser | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1938|4|5}} | birth_place = [[Vilters-Wangs|Vilters]], [[Switzerland]] | residence = [[Zürich]] | education = [[Columbia University]] (M.B.A.) | occupation = Swiss [[Businessperson|businessman]], [[Philanthropy|philanthropist]] and [[Private collection|art collector]] | spouse = Ursula Looser Stingelin | children = 2 }} '''Hubert Looser''' (born 5 April 1938 in [[Vilters-Wangs|Vilters]], [[Switzerland]])<ref name="A">{{cite web |url=http://www.altertuemliches.at/biografie/hubert-looser |title=Hubert Looser |publisher=FindART |access-date=26 April 2018}}</ref> is a former Swiss [[Businessperson|businessman]], [[Philanthropy|philanthropist]] and [[Private collection|art collector]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.museum-folkwang.de/fileadmin/_BE_Gruppe_Folkwang/Dokumente/2016_Pressemitteilungen/Looser/PM_Looser_MuseumFolkwang_Biografie.pdf |title=Biografie Hubert Looser |publisher=Museum Folkwang |access-date=26 April 2018}}</ref> Looser was President of Walter Rentsch Holding AG and ELCO Looser Holding AG. Today Looser is active as a member of the board of the Hubert Looser Foundation.
== Life == Looser was the sixth born of seven children in 1938 in the Swiss town of Vilters, where he also grew up and attended school. His parents were [[Entrepreneurship|entrepreneurs]] and had built the company ELCO. After Looser had earned his MBA from [[Columbia University]] [[New York (state)|New York]],<ref name="A" /> he joined his parents company in 1964 and was responsible for the establishment and leadership of the ELCO Group in [[France]], [[Belgium]] and [[Luxembourg]] until 1980.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.nzz.ch/zuerich/zuercher_kultur/das-kunsthaus-muss-spannender-werden-1.18090779 |title=Das Kunsthaus muss spannender werden |author=Samuel Herzog, Urs Steiner |date=1 June 2013 |publisher=Neue Zürcher Zeitung (NZZ) |access-date=26 April 2018}}</ref>
During this time, the founding of Remaco AG for business mediation and the takeover of Walter Rentsch AG in the field of office technology took place. In 1973, Looser took over the management of Walter Rentsch AG with 120 employees, which at his resignation in 1992, consisted of 1,200 employees. 1990/92 Looser resigned as president of the corporate groups Walter Rentsch AG and ELCO Looser Holding AG.<ref name="B">{{cite web |url=http://fondation-hubert-looser.ch/Literatur/pdf/Der_Sammler_Lebenslauf.pdf |title=Lebenslauf Hubert Looser |date=1 March 2017 |publisher=Fondation Hubert Looser |access-date=26 April 2018}}</ref>
After selling his company shares, Hubert Looser became increasingly involved in the Fondation Hubert Looser, which he co-founded in 1988 and in which he still serves as president and financially supports his fortune with around 40 worldwide [[aid]] projects. Among other things, came the realization of projects for people with disabilities and children in need, as well as training support for young people in countries such as [[Cambodia]], [[Albania]] and [[Romania]] or [[HIV/AIDS|AIDS]] projects in [[South Africa]], [[Zimbabwe]] and [[Nigeria]].<ref name="B" />
Looser is married with Ursula Looser Stingelin, a father of two children from a previous marriage and lives in Zurich.<ref name="A" />
== Art collection == During his stay in Paris in 1957 in order to learn the language, posters from an [[Impressionism|Impressionist]] exhibition made a big impression on him and he went to museums around the world whenever he had the time. In his twenties, Looser completed various study trips during his training period to [[Mexico]], [[Japan]], [[Paris]], [[London]] or [[New York (state)|New York]] and laid the foundation of his passion for collecting art. However, his collections first 200 works were mostly Swiss art. Today, Hubert Looser, is considered to be an outstanding private art collector in the Swiss area. His collections main focus is on works of [[surrealism]], [[Abstract expressionism]] and [[minimalism]]. One of [[Willem de Kooning]]'s largest collections outside of the [[United States|US]] is as part of the collection. The museum-suitable works of the collection were introduced in 2008 to the Fondation Hubert Looser, which makes this cultural asset available to the public as a permanent exhibition at the [[Kunsthaus Zürich]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.blick.ch/life/kunst-kunsthaus-zuerich-erhaelt-74-zeitgenoessische-werke-als-dauerleihgabe-id1854822.html |title=Kunsthaus Zürich erhält 74 zeitgenössische Werke als Dauerleihgabe |publisher=Blick |access-date=26 April 2018}}</ref>

'''Ibrahim Saleem''' (also known as ''Bandhu Ibrahim Saleem'') is a local business expert in [[the Maldives]]. He commenced his career at the Office of the Prime Minister in 1967, from there on he has had an illustrious career spanning over 44 years, holding prominent posts, both in the public and private sector in [[Maldives]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://financeforum.mv/bandh-ibrahim-saleem.html |title=Bandh Ibrahim Saleem |publisher=Maldives Pension Administration Office |date= |accessdate=2012-08-07}}</ref>
==Career== Mr. Saleem commenced his Government Services at the Office of the Prime Minister in 1967. He also served at the Maldives Shipping Limited until he was posted at the Department of Finance as an Assistant Director. In 1991 he became a Director at the Ministry of Finance. He was the Vice Governor of the Maldives to the World Bank from 1982 to 1987. He has also served as Member of the Board of Directors of [[Dhiraagu]], the Maldives Telecommunications Company, Maldives National Shipping Limited and as Chairman of the Board of MTCC and the Maldives Finance Leasing Company.In 1993, Mr. Saleem was appointed Managing Director of the Maldives Transport and Contracting Company (MTCC).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cyprea.com.mv/?page=6b |title=Cyprea Pvt Ltd |publisher=Cyprea Pvt Ltd |date= |accessdate=2012-08-07}}</ref>
Mr. Saleem was appointed the Honorary Consul of Italy in the Maldives in 1999.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://maldivesmission.ch/index.php?id=75 |title=Italy: Welcome to the Permanent Mission of the Republic of Maldives to the United Nations Office at Geneva|publisher=The Permanent Mission of the Republic of Maldives to the United Nations Office at Geneva |date= |accessdate=2012-08-07}}</ref>
He was also the Managing Director of [[Island Aviation Services]] 2002 to 2011. At the Island Aviation Services, he was instrumental in the expansion of the company in terms of fleet capacity of aircraft and passenger flows; and commencing international operations. At present, he is appointed as the Chairman of the board of [[Island Aviation Services]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maldivian.aero/about_maldivian/100_our_management |title=Our Management|publisher=Island Aviation Services|date= |accessdate=2012-08-07}}</ref>
